title: To Fight Plastic Waste, an Indonesian Campaign Aims High
body: To Fight Plastic Waste, an Indonesian Campaign Aims High. Since attorney and activist Tiza Mafira cofounded Plasticdiet Indonesia in 2013, the group has helped more than 100 local governments pass single-use plastic bag bans and is now tackling straws, cutlery, and sachets. readable_content: - Anonymous (2023-12-08): The website displays content about an interview with Tiza Mafira, the co-founder of Plasticdiet Indonesia. She discusses the group's efforts to reduce plastic waste in Indonesia, including advocating for legislation to reduce single-use plastic packaging. The interview covers various aspects of Plasticdiet's work, including its focus on local governments, public perception, and the challenges of individual changes versus systemic change.
summary:
The interview with Tiza Mafira highlights the important efforts of Plasticdiet Indonesia to reduce plastic waste and advocate for legislation to minimize single-use plastic packaging. The focus on local governments and the challenges of generating systemic change reflects a proactive and impactful approach to addressing plastic pollution. Overall, the conversation creates a positive sentiment about the organization's dedication and strategy.
